website_summaries.verdict: These high-quality pedals offer outstanding protection against dirt and water damage.
pros: Fully enclosed design safeguards pedals against dirt and water
Equipped with 16 skid-proof pins for maintaining consistent grip
Lightweight, ultra-thin pedals are simple to install and generate plenty of power when you ride
cons: Limited life compared to similar options
Metal pins sometimes dig into rider's shins

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I'm looking for
customer_reviews.text: Pros: they look super badass they grip really well there are nice and wide and the perfect shape they are super high quality they are lightweight they are inexpensive everything about them is perfect deserves their 5 star rating already smashed them into a rock and pedals are not damaged Cons: none
customer_reviews.author: dean westen

customer_reviews.title: Not as grippy as their other pedals
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I had previously bought their other pedals ( and I thought these looked a little nicer for my new bike. I like the look and they are quality enough, but their ability to grip a sneaker is nowhere near as good as the other. Seems the anti-slip pins are shorter and a little wider; whatever the difference, they simply don't grip as well. I rode with them in wet weather today for the first time and the experience took what would have been a solid 4 star rating to a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made huge difference in kid's attitude.
customer_reviews.text: So my 5 year old would not pedal. He learned everything except pedaling on balance bike. Did not like pedals that came with the bike. What to do? I found those, verified they use standard threads and off we go. They are very light, anodized aluminum in red color, thin and cut from single block. I would not dare put them on my mountain bike other than cross country riding. They look too light for all mountain. No comment regarding downhill. By the way, kid took off and rode. Three weeks later, going like the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Strong, low-profile, wide, "sticky" pedals that work with regular shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very, very nice. Thin, and they stick like glue to the bottom of my regular-guy shoes. The book "Just Ride" argues against clip-on pedals, and shoes, and special socks, and funny padded pants. The author says by time you get all that stuff on you're not interested in riding anymore. I heartily agree. Just wear shoes: the tiny little pins aren't meant for bare feet. The black pedals blend in, and might not scream, "Steal Me" to a degenerate gaping at the bike. The Blue pedals I'm saving for a special occasion: they're just as cool as the black, but it seems like they might get stolen, which would make getting the bike home troublesome.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marks

customer_reviews.title: I bought these to replace a set of pedals that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a set of pedals that cost twice as much and not nearly as well constructed.These pedals really do have 4 sealed bearings. Can't see how they could be anything but maintenance free. My old pedals had to be torn down and greased every 1000 miles or so as the inside bearing was a sleeve bearing. The studs on these pedals are threaded and really grip your shoes, Three spare studs are included in the box. By the way, I bought these for my paved trail bike. I'm closing in on 6000 miles this year. I'll keep you post on how well they hold up. UPDATE: After more than 10,000 miles no trouble at all.
customer_reviews.author: STBecket

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pedals!
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are amazing! My hopes weren't too high because of the cheaper price but the reviews convinced me to try them out. I'm so happy that I did. I put them on my specialized pitch comp 1x. They're so lightweight and very durable. I did a 38 mile ride with them yesterday and had no issues at all. They grip so well onto my five ten freeriders! I highly recommend these pedals to all bikers looking for a cheap yet durable option to stock pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Payton

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive MTB Pedal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pedal to replace the cheap metal pedals that came on my son's 20" Norco Storm MTB. For a seven year old they worked so much better. Large platforms made it easier to pedal and keep up when learning how to mountain bike. Since then, I also bought another pair for use on my 26" park bike and just ordered another pair to replace the stock pedals that came on the Diamondback Sync'r 24" that my oldest son is upgrading too.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: The pedals were easy to install and look great. The only problem I have with them is the color rubbed off the pedal after a month of use. I do ride almost every day, but I would expect the color to last longer than a month. they work great. I only gave 3 stars because I spent a long time selecting a color, when it didn't matter after a month of use. The design of the pedals is great and they work well. I would recommend them, just don't worry too much about the color.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Before buying these pedals, my bike had standard plastic ones with very little grip. If my shoes were even slightly wet, I couldn't trust my pedals enough to pedal very hard without slipping off. These were easy to install (I Know nothing about bikes, watched a 2 min youtube video on how to install pedals) and only took a few minutes to do so. I did however need to purchase a pedal wrench since I had no tool that would work. Very pleased with these so far - they look nice and the grip they provide is worlds better than what I used to use. They feel sturdy and well-made - no complaints
customer_reviews.author: ARS

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and Nice!
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking, and light weight... at least they're lighter than the plastic ones that came with my bike. I thought they'd be heavier, but the core inside my plastic ones were what added weight to those. So far these Bonmix have lasted through rocky, rooty trails where I've had to stand on them because I have a hard tail bike and they're still going strong. I first bought the silver gray color, and then purchased the blue for a pop of color, even though the gray haven't worn out yet.
customer_reviews.author: HerGrooviness

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals! Got these for my 2001 Giant OCR ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals! Got these for my 2001 Giant OCR 3. I'm not ready to make the switch (yet) to clipless. These grip REALLY well to the bottoms of my sneakers. So well I have to lift my foot to adjust position. As far as durability goes, time will tell. The initial impression is good though. They are a tad heavy (despite the low profile) but for now that's not a big deal. I figure by the time I'm ready to get carbon fork, seat post, bars, stem..... I'll be ready to invest in clipless and the shoes to go with.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Upgrade and Good value
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how Specialized can make a mountain bike with such crappy plastic pedals. Huge improvement--think, light weight and strong. My feet no longer slip off the pedals--really nice when there is a little bit of moisture. Get yourself a good pedal wrench to get the old one off with. Very pleased look nice on the bicycle too.
customer_reviews.author: Rather Be Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Durable, economical, functional, and nice style.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my Hardtail bike, I got them because I liked that they were one piece construction, my old pedals were super cool looking, but were 2 piece held together by the grip pins, I noticed as I would get a rock strike on the old pedals and it would sheer off the pins, the halves of the pedals began to get loose. Not with these! and these are a little thinner so the rock strikes are a little less, pretty good traction on them and they look pretty cool, can't complain about the price either, all in all a great pedal for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: no1cr500racer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, quality pedals. So far.
customer_reviews.text: i've only put around 30 urban miles on these pedals, so take what I say with a grain of salt. They are lightweight, smooth, inexpensive, look cool, and grip your shoes very well. Can't address the issue of lack of grip with deep, sparse treads or hiking shoes while mountain biking, although I'd expect them to perform equally as well. I rode them with Merrill low tops with a vibram sole. No five stars until I ride a few hundred miles on them. They came in two days and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: jake-a-zon

customer_reviews.title: These are very nice pedals, and in particular if you factor in ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice pedals, and in particular if you factor in the price. They are good size so you can get on them on fast, and after about 20 rides seem very durable while still being lightweight. The customer services is also fantastic. Be sure to tighten up all the anti-slip nails before your first ride if you ride on single track trails with rock gardens to avoid having any nails get knocked out. The grips on the pedals is excellent with the nails in place.
customer_reviews.author: krroller

customer_reviews.title: Shaft broke while pedaling on flat pavement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these inn 2018 and they worked great for exactly two years, then while accelerating on flat pavement the right pedal just snapped off! I was able to avoid crashing, but if this had happened on a trail it could have been disastrous. I think I need to pay more attention to the one star reviews, this has apparently happened a lot. I also couldn't find any warranty info or even a website for the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: I Love White Water Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Good pedals for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality pedals for the price. They are very light and rotate very smoothly. The pins work good at keeping my feet on em while mountain biking in rough terrain. Only downsides are the the threads for the pin holes seem to be fairly week, so you can't tighten them too much. I took out the pins and applied a bit of loctite to each which seemed to help. The pins also are not stainless so they do rust.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Look great, just hope they hold up over time
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily and look great on the bike. I’m concerned about the pedals shearing off at the post (as a few others have noted) and will revisit this review of that happens. But so far, so good. Really good looking pedals with less slippage (due to the metal studs) than I had with my prior polymer pedals that came stock on my Fuji hybrid
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedals!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pedals. I use them on two of my mountain bikes and they are perfect. They have a great wide platform yet they are very lightweight. Four bearing system provides the durability that I like in mountain bike pedals. My favorite thing about them is that they don't use the spacers typically found in lots of pedals that seperate the top and bottom foot plates and thus weaken the platform (they use solid alloy). Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: av8or

customer_reviews.title: Very good Pedals for the price
customer_reviews.text: The pedals are well built. They don't look cheap like other brands at this price point. I have them on my hybrid/city bike and have been using them on 10-15 mile rides almost daily for a few weeks. So far, I'm very happy with them. I
customer_reviews.author: Hche

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pedals to replace some hard plastic pedals on my bicycle that were starting to crack. This was my first time replacing pedals on my bicycle, so I'll admit I had to look on youtube to figure out that one side loosens counter-clockwise and the other side loosens clockwise for removal. With this knowledge, it only took 5 minutes to replace both pedals. Once the pedals were on my bike, it took a little getting used to the new feel. They are a little wider than my old pedals, which seemed awkward at first, but by the end of my 12 mile ride I had fully adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals! Very good improvement over basic pedals
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals! Very good improvement over basic pedals. The studs are very grippy on a normal shoe while hopefully less dangerous to flesh in the event of a fall and subsequent scrapes. They seem solid too but only time will tell if they take the kind of abuse I throw at a pedal. It seems like the gears are likely to sheer before these pedals give way.
customer_reviews.author: Mordacain

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The paint is sleek not thick you can see the aluminum texture which is what I like about them. Light weight lighter than the plastic stock ones that come with the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Large, light; improved grip
customer_reviews.text: Only had these on my bike for a few rides so far. Easy install with 16mm wrench, they are labeled R and L for safety. They are lighter than the standard pedal despite being significantly larger. I wear relatively large shoes for riding, and with my trailrunners on, these are so much better for grip and surface area than the standard pedals that came with my hybrid cross bike. I cannot comment on the durability but they feel substantial and the spindle looks well designed.
customer_reviews.author: MikeNinety

customer_reviews.title: Quality build
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure my new trail bike included peddles, since they were omitted from the photos, so I ordered a pair of these. Must say the quality is very good and the peddles are noticeably lighter than the ones provided ( which we'll be keeping them to replace my wife's plastic bike peddles). These peddles look good and the ball bearings should help with peddling long distances.
customer_reviews.author: slidersrus

customer_reviews.title: High quality, low cost pedal replacement that will improve your riding experience!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe how cheap these were for such a high quality replacement pedal. Huge difference over the plastic stock pedals. When off the bike the shaft rotation is very smooth by hand with these pedals. This was not the case with the brand new stock pedals I took off. The BONMIXC pedals are light weight and they are just enough larger than the stock pedals that fit my feet perfectly. I can really pick up speed without my foot slipping at all. Highly impressed with these pedals and recommend them to anyone who wants a better riding experience at a very low cost and easy to install upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Steve1234567890

customer_reviews.title: Bent after minor crash. Company said mine were a defect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pedals because they are so low profile and have a cool design. Unfortunately the materials do not stack up to the asthetics. The right pedal bent on the first minor crash I had with them on. I was able to bend it back and an all using them but I haven't had another crash. They are fine for road or light trail riding but definitely don't buy for medium to hard trail riding. After I posted my review Bonmixc contacted me. They said I probably got a defect and fully refunded my purchase which was very cool of them. They have excellent customer support!
customer_reviews.author: Elias Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable pair of flat pedals
customer_reviews.text: These are a solid replacement for your standard 3 inch pedals. I put them on my MTB and they work great and the black fits the color of the bike. If you want an affordable set of flats this is your set. Plus they give you a few extra replacement steel bolts in case some break or fall out.
customer_reviews.author: AAC9598

customer_reviews.title: Durable and light pedals. Great replacement for price.
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my older pedals went bust, and must admit, I am really surprised how durable and light these pedals are! They spin really well and they are easy to install. You will need a 9/16 wrench and a 5mm hex key for installation. UPDATE: I smashed my bike while riding on a rocky pathway and guess what? the pedals were not damaged and all of the pins were in place, the black finished was a little scratched but other than that they were working fine! This is a MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.author: DARYT TOWER

customer_reviews.title: Like Nike, just do it.
customer_reviews.text: After getting my road bike, took this baby to my LBS & told them to show me what they have that might be better than this beauty. He came back with 3 sets of pedals, ranging between $60-$100. Cut the long story short, only the $100 weight lesser than this. And there’s no way I’m getting it. The difference in weight is barely noticeable. Though I haven’t put them to work yet. It’s already paying for itself.
customer_reviews.author: iamLuqman

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedals
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pedals as a replacement for my clip-in pedals on my mountain bike. Got them installed no problem and I really like the grip the little studs provide. The set also came with additional studs in the event you lose some out on the trail. The platform area is large. I'd say my only negative would be they are a little heavy, but only compared to my old clip-in shoes, but still lightweight for the size of the pedal (clip-in pedals were obviously smaller).
customer_reviews.author: Ian Rogers

customer_reviews.title: The are good for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I had these pedals awhile and got a ball bearing click. The company replaced them, and not the left pedal completely broke off. The are good for awhile, but not the higher quality I thought they might be for $35. I am past warranty now, so ymmv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pedals. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals. So much better than the ones that came with the bike. Nice large size that fits my feet better. Good grip also and very well made. 👍🚴
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, looks great!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have both ridden on these for a year. They're still in terrific condition, and we haven't lost any pins. These are awesome pedals, and the price is great. The pins in these will definitely tear up your shins, but that's the nature of pins!
customer_reviews.author: Steve-O

customer_reviews.title: The pedals are great if they last
customer_reviews.text: broke after 4 months. The pedals are great if they last. The company replaced the petals that broken very good customer service and will update if anything happened to the new panels The company replaced the petals that broken very good customer service and will update if anything happened to the new panels
customer_reviews.author: thebigguy

customer_reviews.title: These pedals look fantastic and provide plenty of grip
customer_reviews.text: These pedals look fantastic and provide plenty of grip. You can also tell the build quality is very good. Word of caution, you need 1/2" pedals for 1 piece BMX bike cranks. I was able to get these pedals to work by installing them with some 9/16" to 1/2" pedal extenders.
customer_reviews.author: travis0260

customer_reviews.title: Less secure feeling than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: When stepping on this pedal my primary point of contact is not the traction spikes but the smooth axel running down the middle. I found that my old fashioned basic steel pedals felt much more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best bike pedal I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I have traveled thousands of miles by bike in the last ten years; I love these pedals. They have some of the benefits of cleats, without the drawbacks. The price is awesome. Good Work! I put these on every bike I own.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your money.
customer_reviews.text: Light and seemed to be well constructed. Update: if you downhill, gravity or free ride this things will take a beating. I'm buying these when it comes time to upgrade my current bike. Best pedals you can buy at this price and compete with name brand ones. Update. Still kicking after 6 months an few bangs against roots sticking out, trees, rocks and such.
customer_reviews.author: Abel A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the weight reduced!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely light. Every oz reduced helps. Love the blue finish on them as well. They also come with spare cleats! Will see how durable in the coming year they hold, but feel reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedals
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pedals. They were fairly inexpensive, have a large flat area and have grips that don't let your foot slip. I put these on when I got a bike trailer for my mountain bike. Using clipless pedals and shoes to go to the park with my son was not going to work. There is really nothing I dislike about these.
customer_reviews.author: tron1974

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These pedals have been great from the first ride. They were easy to install and they ride smoothly. The small spikes provide a very solid grip on rubber soled shoes like sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: JBrun

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, low profile pedals
customer_reviews.text: Good, low profile pedals. I wanted something more durable than the plastic pedals that came with my Stumpy. These have worked perfectly. They have good traction and the studs aren't so long that I'm worried about stitches if I slip off of them. They also look really nice. I get a lot of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedals for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice pedals for the money. However, the pedals don't spin as freely or easily. Also a bit heavier as compared to the CORKI-12 which has titanium axle and better bearings so the pedals spin much more smoothly and freely. The CORKI-12 cost a bit more, but IMO are worth the extra $20.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, impressed
customer_reviews.text: These will mark the first time I've upgrade pedals on my bike. Got a cheap used fat tires and wanted a larger platform to stand on. These fit the bill. The studs help grip my shoe and with more surface area I feel a lot more confident putting the power to the pedal. I think I'll be ordering another pair for my hybrid.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Iroh

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be more contented.
customer_reviews.text: Great looks and superb function. Low profile and grippy. Large platform means sure footing even if I just place my foot for frequent on-off action specially during busy street rides.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy A.

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: I have had about 10 good rides on these pedals. They are a great size for my US 13 sized feet. I have yet to have an issue with my foot slipping off or a pedal flipping over under a lot of pressure. I have had a few good pedal strikes and aside from a few scratches, all is fine. No bending even after I really tagged the left pedal on a rock yesterday. I am very pleased with the quality of pedal you get for the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful petals with awesome grip. Buy these
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful selection of colors. These are nice and Light and have killer grip. Just tighten down the things and maybe put some Loctite on them. I was really surprised on how these made my Rockhopper pop. I posted a pic to show you what I mean. I would definitely recommend these pedals for the price and for Style.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Look nice and very light for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, just a bit concerned that some have reported that the axle can shear off at the crank arm under load. I hope that this has been corrected in the newer stock.
customer_reviews.author: bikeguy360

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mountain bike pedals
customer_reviews.text: I have had these pedals now for almost two years and I don't have a single complaint. We ride at least twice a week in rocky desert terrain and these pedals have taken a beating. They have plenty of dings and scratches but they are quite and spin as if they were new. The size is perfect, they look great and have good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pedals. I use them with my Keen sandals ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pedals. I use them with my Keen sandals and they work great on my tour bike. The flat pins along the edges help keep your foot in place so the pedals are not slippery. You even get a few extra pins. Nice large platform, very comfortable. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: ... the panels on my stationary bike and he said like a good sturdy pedal easy on and have some ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace the panels on my stationary bike and he said like a good sturdy pedal easy on and have some grip to be billeting to be able to clip onto my sneakers on my feet outside of the pedals that came with the bike or just not good at their plastic in my feet keep sliding off.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Thin and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Thin and light weight. They are of comparable size to the original aluminum pedals, but much thinner. As another review pointed out they're a bit stiff out of the box, but loosen after a few hours of riding.
customer_reviews.author: cam jones

customer_reviews.title: I love the thin profile
customer_reviews.text: This is the third set I’ve purchased. I love the thin profile. They send you extra screws because they eventually fall out. I can’t complain because the price to performance is great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Garner

customer_reviews.title: Bargain tough pedal
customer_reviews.text: Over 1200 miles and dozens of rock strikes later, these pedals are still rolling strong. The grip spikes are not as sharp as some of the higher end pedals, so there is slightly more slip but it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: right hook

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedal
customer_reviews.text: Good pedal. Bearings are very smooth. Size and weight of pedal is great for rough riding. Sturdy build. These went on my Alaskan backpacking bike, to be used with back country hiking boots in nasty terrain. The gripping studs on these pedals were polished slick, and didn't match the tread pattern on my boots. I removed the studs and bolted on the toothed cleats from my old pedals. Problem solved. Good pedals. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Larson

customer_reviews.title: These look and work great! I have them on my Santa Cruz Bronson ...
customer_reviews.text: These look and work great! I have them on my Santa Cruz Bronson XX1 carbon. They are heavy compared to $300 pedals, but they are the piece that will get the most abuse!
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck these are a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I think bang for buck these are a hit! Easy to install, came with extra studs and have a very smooth feel when spinning. I use Five Ten Freerider shoes and they work very well as a clipless combo for sure. They're pretty close to the plastic set that came standard on my Trek in weight and I like how open they are through the center to let mud and dirt through. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Second set for a new bike
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set bought for a new bicycle. They seem well made. I would suggest that the studs be removed to add a small amount of blue thread locker to prevent them from being lost.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wynn

customer_reviews.title: these pedals look great and have held up great so far
customer_reviews.text: these pedals look great and have held up great so far. I find the grips not quite grabby enough for winter use here in Minnesota so I plan to sharpen them out a little before next winter but really these pedals have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I love these, They grip very effectively
customer_reviews.text: I love these, They grip very effectively, no slipping and have a 4x4 surface area which feels great on the bottom of your feet. I bought these in red to match the color of my bike. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Whicker

customer_reviews.title: Great service, great product
customer_reviews.text: Should've got these a long time ago. Freaking awesome. Love them...
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: works great, looks great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just the right spin/grip. They don't spin like a flywheel nor do they stick too hard either... It has a combination of grip and slip so its not extreme grip or totally smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pedals a few months back and I have certainly put them to the test on trails. From pedal strikes, hammering through rock gardens, big drops and big jumps these pedals have held up. The grip is amazing, the size is just about perfect and the bearings are great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Work well and look great
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pedals and they look great on the bike. They are slightly oversize, so they do stick out some, but I have big feet so these work well for me. My wife likes them as well, though she has size 7 feet.
customer_reviews.author: JAH-Just a Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Got them fast and they look awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look and price of these! So far the have held up well and been quiet and smooth. Been riding them a couple of months and they have been through mud and water several times.
customer_reviews.author: jimmymcclain

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals, great price
customer_reviews.text: Nice pedals. Feel light, look nice on the bike, and are super comfortable while also providing killer grip. Only reason I can't give five stars is because after about 20-30 miles of riding I've had two of the medal studs fall out. Aside from that, great pedals at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, good grip and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Excellent quality, good grip and easy to install. Much better than standard plastic pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan

customer_reviews.title: great pedals for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great pedals for the price! I can't believe how much better my feet grip to them versus the stock pedals that came on the bike. The bearings are a little tight, but I'm hoping after a few rides they loosen up.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Great flats
customer_reviews.text: Went back to flats for the Mesa riding in Southern Utah and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great grip.
customer_reviews.text: Way sikkk pedals...runnin them on 2 of my bmx rigs....great grip...light...awesome 4 bearing system....just tighten or loc tight the grip studs and your good to go...highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: marcuss

customer_reviews.title: quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals. Wide. These replaced some pedals that stripped the threads of my crank.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Pedal sheared off after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Pedals worked well enough and had a good grip. However, almost killed myself when it sheared off the bike after 3-4 months use. The company did provide a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They grip my shoes great and are a little slimmer than the OEM pedals ...
customer_reviews.text: They have taken a beating on rocks and logs, but have shown no wear. They grip my shoes great and are a little slimmer than the OEM pedals so I have a little more clearance. Very smooth!
customer_reviews.author: SeltzerTime

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good pedals for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good pedals for cheap. They are light and thin. The only reason I didn't give them five stars is that I think they need a couple more pins per side that are taller and a little skinnier. But overall they are pretty decent
customer_reviews.author: B and B

customer_reviews.title: These RED puppies are BAD AZZ
customer_reviews.text: These RED puppies are BAD AZZ. Light weight and smooth bearings guarantee ride great. The tiny spikes help you keep your feet well planted. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and durable
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality. Looks great too. My kids love it
customer_reviews.author: Ruta

customer_reviews.title: Very good pedal for both a good price and high quality like that of more expensive pedals
customer_reviews.text: Smooth bearings, nice color, and light... 347 grams for the pair. They seem to be serviceable and I believe they'll last me years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Natalka

customer_reviews.title: revision
customer_reviews.text: update: i wish to apologize to BonMixic, i had hit the wrong pedals when i reported that they had broken with in a few months of usage. As a matter of fact i have the Bonmixc on both my MTB and my crossover and they work good. Have not had any issue... knock on wood!
customer_reviews.author: Scott D.

customer_reviews.title: I love these pedals
customer_reviews.text: I love these pedals - beautiful red color and perfectly grippy
customer_reviews.author: DBC

customer_reviews.title: Really nice upgrade from stock pedals on a mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: Really nice upgrade from stock pedals on a mountain bike. Slightly larger than stock and seem to work well after just a few uses. Definitely hold get more securely than original pedals and are still comfortable. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking pedals, lighter than my old ones. Good seals from what I can tell. I've taken them out a couple of times and hit a rock with no ill effects. They feel fine. I'll get back if there are any problems.
customer_reviews.author: AZAmbler

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and solid pedals
customer_reviews.text: my husband bought these and LOVES them. very sturdy and solid pedals. exactly what he wanted/needed.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen Family

customer_reviews.title: Pedal bent
customer_reviews.text: It looks like the threads where not tight, pedal bent inside the threaded crank. SRAM XO1 crank. I would like to return but I don't see a return option on this product. Update: the company stood behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: and get stripped easily. Remember
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if you weigh over 150 lbs. Screw in studs are cheap, fall out, and get stripped easily. Remember, don't skimp on the gear for the contact points (feet, hands, butt!)
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great Pedals. Good surface area for your foot. The little protruding bolts keep your shoe on the pedal to prevent slipping, so don't pedal barefoot. Easy installation and low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Good Traction
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pedals with great traction, but if you aren’t paying attention that great traction will bite your shins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I super love these pedals. Light weight compared to my old beat up plastic pedals. The old one went straight to the trash coz it's definitely garbage! These pedals are high quality and will most definitely can tell the difference. It would not slip on my shoes even if I tried. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Noel M.

customer_reviews.title: First impressions and initial quality = excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Love how thin these pedals are and the way they look on my YT.! Lots of grips and super stable on the first couple of rides. There are no issues! Will update if they fail or something. For now, for $30, they are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Philip271

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Great price, very light, came with replacement platform studs in case you lose a few. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: James HenryCloyd, PhD

customer_reviews.title: ... Giant Escape 2 pedals with these and they are excellent. A bit wider and the studs are in ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Giant Escape 2 pedals with these and they are excellent. A bit wider and the studs are in the right places and your foot stays planted on the pedal. They are comfortable and come with extra studs. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PRMAX

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Lightweight and sturdy. Customer service a plus as well when I lost a couple of the nails on a hard ride.
customer_reviews.author: Schwal

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great, but they outshine my bike!
customer_reviews.text: Received these (red) a few weeks ago to use on my new $4500 mtn bike. They look great, hold your shoes firmly and rotate smoothly. Only problem is I get more compliments on my pedals than I do on my new bike!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well done
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pedals. I have two bikes and after buying a black set and and using them I now have a second set for my new bike being delivered today. Pro's Light weight, good grip, smooth turning, look great,good size. Con's.. None
customer_reviews.author: ssb

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Light weight. Grips your shoes and keeps your feet from slipping. They look great! My wife liked them so much she bought a set. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals, wish they had just a bit more grip
customer_reviews.text: for the price I really like these pedals. The grip is 'almost' perfect which is probably the only reason i'm dropping one star. I wish the pedals had a few more pegs for better grip.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pedals
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are an excellent value. I actually get compliments on my pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: awesome looking pedals that work great
customer_reviews.text: love the look and feel of these pedals..i feel my feet are much less likely to slip off than using the ones that came with my mountain bike..east to install which is a biggie for me
customer_reviews.author: IrwinFl3tch3r

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 27.5 full suspension bike. I have 62 miles of hard trail riding and only lost one pin. Luckily they send 3 extras so I tightened all of the pins and have been very happy. I've seen so broken pedals and bad reviews but for me. They have been great and I'm hard on things. Very happy and would definately but again
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kandel

customer_reviews.title: great grip, and good
customer_reviews.text: Seem strong, very lightweight, good grip, and nice looking. Great customer service - 6 months after purchase, a few pins came out and Bonmixc immediately sent me dozens of new ones for free!
customer_reviews.author: Toby

product_meta.title: BONMIXC Bike Pedals 9/16 Sealed Bearing Sturdy Structure Ultralight Weight Mountain Bike Pedals Alloy Bicycle Pedals
feature_bullets: SEALED BEARING - 100% Cr-Mo spindle 9/16 threading with sealed bearing, ride efficiently.

ULTRATHIN SIZE AND ULTRALIGHT WEIGHT - AL6061 Aluminum alloy bike pedals in ultrathin design brings lightweight, high strength and long durability features. Size 3.98x4.60x0.75 inches and Weight 0.37lb each, saving 30% of the driving power.

STURDY STRUCTURE - Unique triangular design and CNC technology strengthen the bike pedals with more stability and more durability. Even riding on a rugged mountain road, you'll feel safer and more comfortable.
ANTISKID PINS - 16pcs replaceable skid-proof pins for an enhanced grip. 3pcs spare pins for replacement. Enjoy your riding with safe.

INTERNATIONAL STANDARD THREAD - 9/16" screw thread, diameter 14.3mm, suitable for most of the mountain bikes, road bikes, BMX bikes, folding bikes, urban bikes, travel bikes, cyclo-cross bikes, fixed gear bikes, unicycles, scooters, e-bike and etc.
